justification: "Participants were asked to play a one-shot PGG … to test the stability across the lifespan of the intuition for cooperation," indicating the PGG was the instrument used to measure cooperative behaviour.
"Dictator games have been used traditionally to measure pure altruism rather than cooperative behaviour," showing the DG served as the measure of altruism.

measured_by: Classical risk-aversion task / elicited certainty equivalents
justification: "Adding elicited certainty equivalents (a measure of risk aversion that we elicited using a standard task 29)" specifies that a standard risk-aversion task provided the measure.

measured_by: Optimism Bias task (subjective probability estimates of negative events)
justification: "In the Optimism Bias task, participants were presented with 10 statements… and were asked to report the likelihood that that same event could happen to them… An index of optimism was constructed by averaging these estimates," confirming the task operationalised optimism.
"Participants answered a 10-item questionnaire, known as the Need to Belong Scale… aimed at assessing their desire and need for social contact and inclusion," identifying the scale as the measure.
construct: Need to belong / Desire for social acceptance

justification: "Participants were asked to estimate the contribution of their two partners… These two estimates were then averaged to construct a variable, called expected cooperation," showing how the construct was measured.
construct: Expected cooperation / Beliefs about partners’ cooperation
